zh.title: 以太坊/美元技术分析：[震荡整理，等待突破信号]
zh.content:
当前以太坊/美元(ETH/USD)价格为1952.43，近期波动幅度较小，显示出震荡整理的趋势。尽管24小时变化仅为0.17%，但市场在1946.41和1966.47区间内保持窄幅波动，表明短期内市场缺乏明确方向。价格保持在SMA(20)下方，显示出一定的下行压力。

技术指标方面，MACD为负值（-6.40110），未见明显的反弹信号，表明当前市场的卖压仍然占据主导地位。RSI(14)数据缺失，未能提供过度买入或卖出的信号。当前市场可能处于等待突破的阶段，投资者需关注价格能否突破1966.47的高点，或回调至1946.41附近的支撑位。

在支撑与阻力方面，1946.41为关键支撑位，若价格跌破此水平，可能会加速下行至更低的支撑区间。1966.47是短期内的阻力位，突破此位可能会带来新的上涨动力。投资者可以根据价格突破这两个关键点来决定进场时机。

综合来看，当前市场处于震荡整理阶段，建议投资者耐心等待突破信号的出现。若价格突破1966.47，可考虑做多；若跌破1946.41，则可考虑做空，谨慎操作并设置合理的止损。

en.title: Ethereum vs US Dollar Technical Analysis
en.content:
Ethereum is trading at 1952.43, hovering just below the psychological 2000 level and marginally positive on the day. Price action remains compressed within the 1946–1966 intraday range, reflecting short-term consolidation rather than impulsive momentum. The broader structure shows mild downside pressure as price continues to trade beneath the 20-period simple moving average at 1981.82, indicating that near-term trend bias is still slightly bearish.

The negative MACD reading at -6.40 reinforces this cautious tone, signaling that bearish momentum has not fully dissipated. While the absence of RSI data limits overbought or oversold assessment, the positioning below the 20-day SMA suggests sellers retain modest control. However, the narrow daily range and muted percentage change imply weakening downside momentum, potentially forming a base for stabilization if buying interest increases.

Immediate support is located near 1945–1950, aligned with the session low at 1946.41. A decisive break below this zone could expose 1920 and potentially 1900 as next downside objectives. On the upside, initial resistance sits around 1965–1970, followed by stronger resistance at the 20-day SMA near 1982. A sustained move above 1985 would improve short-term structure and shift bias toward a recovery phase targeting the 2000–2025 region.

Short-term traders may consider range-based strategies while price remains confined between 1945 and 1985, favoring disciplined entries near support and resistance boundaries. Momentum traders should await a confirmed breakout with expanding volume before committing to directional exposure. Risk management remains essential, particularly given compressed volatility, as breakouts from such consolidation phases often produce sharp, rapid moves.
